com.magnet.android.mms.async

Class ReliableCallOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.magnet.android.mms.async.Options
      • com.magnet.android.mms.async.ReliableCallOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ReliableCallOptions
extends Options
implements Serializable
    Options for reliable (guaranteed delivery) calls. The default settings are as follows:
    • A default FIFO queue is used.
    • A single thread is used in the default queue (sequential execution).
    • The cache age is 0 (discard cached result).
    • A cache over constraint policy is used (check the cache before evaluating the constraint).
    • Calls are automatically queued with an implicit NetworkConstraint (with any data connection).
    • THere is no expiry time for calls.
    • There is no token (duplicated requests are not checked).
    • No custom contextual tags are included, except for system level contextual tags.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • checkCache

        public ReliableCallOptions checkCache(boolean cacheFirst)
        Deprecated. Use checkCacheFirst(boolean)
        Check the availability of the cached result before evaluating the constraint. The default is true.
        Parameters:
        cacheFirst - Set to true to check the cache first; set to false to evaluate the constraint first.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.

      • checkCacheFirst

        public ReliableCallOptions checkCacheFirst(boolean cacheFirst)
        Check the availability of the cached result before evaluating the constraint. The default is true.
        Parameters:
        cacheFirst - Set to true to check the cache first; set to false to evaluate the constraint first.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.

      • setConstraint

        public ReliableCallOptions setConstraint(Constraint constraint)
        Specify a constraint that determines when the call can be invoked. Typically a result cache will be checked for availability before evaluating the constraint. The caller can flip the sequence by passing a value of false to checkCache(boolean).
        Parameters:
        constraint - A constraint that determines when the call can be invoked.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.

      • setToken

        public ReliableCallOptions setToken(String token)
        Specify a unique token for a call to avoid an unintended duplicated outstanding call. Be careful when sharing a ReliableCallOptions object with the same token used by multiple calls; some calls may be treated as duplicated invocations. When a duplicated token is detected, the original Call object will be returned, and no callback will be issued.
        Parameters:
        token - An application-wide unique token, or null if not set.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.

      • setQueueName

        public ReliableCallOptions setQueueName(String queueName)
        Sets the name of the queue. Each queue represents one worker thread to execute the asynchronous call. If the name is not set, a default queue will be used.
        Parameters:
        queueName - The name of the queue.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.

      • setIntent

        public ReliableCallOptions setIntent(String action,
                            Serializable extras)
        Broadcast an intent with this action and extras when the state is changed. The broadcast will be local, and the intent will contain the call ID in String Call.EXTRA_CALL_ID, the call state in String Call.EXTRA_CALL_STATE and the serializable extras Call.EXTRA_EXTRAS. The StartActivityReceiver utility class can be used to redirect the intent to an Activity.
        Parameters:
        action - A unique action string scoped by a package name.
        extras - Optional extras added to the intent, or null.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.
        See Also:
        StartActivityReceiver

      • setCacheAge

        public ReliableCallOptions setCacheAge(int duration,
                              TimeUnit unit,
                              boolean useCacheIfOffline)
        Set an acceptable age for a cached result. Without using this option or setting the duration to 0, the result will always come from the server. Otherwise, if the result is available its age is within the duration, it will be fetched from the cache. In offline mode, if useCacheIfOffline is set to true, the result will be fetched from the cache.
        Parameters:
        duration - Set to 0 to discard the cache immediately, specify Options.NO_CACHE_AGE for no cache age, or specify a value greater than 0.
        unit - The time units for the duration.
        useCacheIfOffline - Set to true to always use the cache if offline; set to false otherwise.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.

      • setCallTimeout

        public ReliableCallOptions setCallTimeout(int duration,
                                 TimeUnit unit)
        Specify the timeout for the call sitting in the queue. A 0 duration means no expiry time. When the call is timed out, it will have the Call.State.TIMEDOUT state. However, the event delivery is not guaranteed in a timely manner; it will be delivered when the condition of the constraint is changed, or when another call is put in the same queue.
        Parameters:
        duration - The timeout value must be at least 0.
        unit - The time units for the duration.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Call timeout duration must be at least 0.

      • addTag

        public ReliableCallOptions addTag(Class<? extends Tag> tag,
                         Call.When when)
        Add a tag to a call when the call is made or sent. The tag value is evaluated dynamically for each call. It is different from the static tag in addTag(String, String) and addTags(Map). A duplicated tag will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag to be added to the call.
        when - Specify Call.When.SUBMIT or Call.When.SEND.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.
        See Also:
        Tag.GEOLOCATION, Tag.NETWORK, Tag.REQUEST_TIME

      • addTag

        public ReliableCallOptions addTag(String name,
                         String value)
        Add a static tag to a call. The tag value remains unchanged. A duplicated tag will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        name - The tag name.
        value - The tag value.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the tag name is invalid.
        See Also:
        Tag.GEOLOCATION, Tag.NETWORK, Tag.REQUEST_TIME

      • addTags

        public ReliableCallOptions addTags(Map<String,String> tags)
        Add a set of static tags to a call. The tag values remain unchanged. Duplicated headers will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        tags - A map of name-value pairs.
        Returns:
        The reliable call options.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the tag has an invalid name.
        See Also:
        Tag.GEOLOCATION, Tag.NETWORK, Tag.REQUEST_TIME
